1.content: Which character shall we start with?
1.title: Select A Character

11.content:
Which of the younger kids do we focus on?

Ryan McHiggins, age 2.5. The son of Walter and Wendy, and a smart and kind but cowardly toddler. His fears include bullies, thunder and lightning, and the rabbit who sells batteries on television. Nonetheless, if one of his friends is being bullied, he will put aside his cowardice long enough to save them. His goals in life are to be a brave hero and to be toilet-trained before his third birthday. Ryan takes after his father, Walter, in both looks and personality.

Brad Hunter, age 2.5. The son of Stephen and Ashley, and an adventurous toddler who is Ryan's best friend. Brad is a lot more adventurous than Ryan is, and often tries to talk him into going on dangerous adventures. He does care a lot about Ryan, though, and is often quick to defend him if someone is trying to hurt him physically or emotionally. Brad's interests include sports, video games, and sports-themed video games. Brad takes after his father, Stephen, in personality, but his mother, Ashley, in looks.

Alice Finklemeyer, age 2.5. The daughter of Hector and Helen. Alice is beautiful as she is kind. Her favorite toy is Orville, a teddy bear she got from the mall in her old home on her second birthday. When she first moved in next to the McHiggins' house, she won the hearts of Ryan and Brad with her beauty, but the three settled on being just really good friends with each other for the time being. Ryan and Brad are extremely loyal to Alice, and will protect her from Butch at any costs. Alice is afraid of spiders, and will freak out if one gets near her.
11.title: One of the Younger Kids

111.content: Where will Ryan be spending the day?
111.title: Ryan McHiggins

1111.content:
Ryan was spending the day at his house.

Did he have any friends come to visit him?
1111.title: His House

11111.content: Which friend or friends came to visit Ryan?
11111.title: Yes

111111.content:
Brad came to visit Ryan.

What did the two toddlers play with?
111111.title: Brad

choices: One or More of Them Needed to Use the Bathroom
Another of Ryan's Friends Came Over
Wendy Called Them into the Kitchen For a Snack
1111112.content:
Ryan and Brad decided to play with Ryan's toy trains. Before long, the two toddlers built an oval-shaped layout that had a stone bridge, a tunnel, a water tower, and a level crossing. Ryan chose to play with the blue train to match his blue shirt, while Brad chose the green one to match his green shirt.

As the two toddlers played with their trains, what happened?
1111112.title: Ryan's Toy Trains

11111121.content: Did both toddlers need to use the bathroom or just one?
11111121.title: One or More of Them Needed to Use the Bathroom

111111212.content: Who needed to use the bathroom?
111111212.title: Just One

11111122.content: The doorbell rang. Another of Ryan's friends came over to play. Who was it?
11111122.title: Another of Ryan's Friends Came Over

111113.content:
Luke had come to visit Ryan.

What did the two toddlers play with?
111113.title: Luke

choices: One or More of Them Needed to Use the Bathroom
Another of Ryan's Friends Came Over
Wendy Called Them into the Kitchen For a Snack
1111131.content:
Ryan and Luke decided to play with Ryan's wooden blocks. Ryan was an expert at building things, whether it was block towers, wooden train tracks, or sandcastles. Before long, the two toddlers had built an amazing tower.

As the two toddlers continued to build, what happened?
1111131.title: Ryan's Wooden Blocks

11111311.content: Did both toddlers need to use the bathroom or just one?
11111311.title: One or More of Them Needed to Use the Bathroom

111113112.content: Who needed to use the bathroom?
111113112.title: Just One

112.content: Where will Brad be spending the day today?
112.title: Brad Hunter

113.content: Where will Alice be spending the day today?
113.title: Alice Finklemeyer

1131.content: Do any friends visit her?
1131.title: Her House

11311.content: Which friend or friends visit Alice?
11311.title: Yes

113111.content:
Ryan came to visit.

What did the two toddlers play?
113111.title: Ryan

choices: One or More of Them Needed to Use the Bathroom
Another of Alice's Friends Came Over
Helen Called Them into the Kitchen for a Snack
1131111.content:
The two toddlers decided to play house. Alice got out her Tiny Townspeople dollhouse so she and Ryan could play with it. The two toddlers enjoyed acting out the various family roles.

As they played, what happened?
1131111.title: House

11311112.content: Was it one of the Johnson sisters?
11311112.title: Another of Alice's Friends Came Over

113111122.content: Who else could it be?
113111122.title: Anyone else.

1131111222.content: Turns out it's only one of them?
1131111222.title: Mike and/or Melanie

113113.content: Doo all 3 enter the house at the same time, however?
113113.title: The Johnson Sisters

choices: Mike and Melanie, or anyone else.
113115.title: Someone Else

1132.content: She ends up at Mike's house?
1132.title: A Friend's House

11322.content: Whose house could Alice go to?
11322.title: At someone else's house.

114.content:
Okay, then. How about:

Luke O'Reilly, age 2.5. The son of Colleen and Connor. Luke is an Irish toddler who's shy but friendly. He has made friends with other toddlers his age, namely Ryan McHiggins, Brad Hunter, Alice Finklemeyer, and Winston Bixby. Like many toddlers his age, he still wears diapers, but is getting used to being potty-trained. His pet is a cat named Lucky.

Winston Bixby, age 2.5. The son of Albert and Geraldine, and the younger brother of Amanda (age 6), and Jonathan (age 4). Like most toddlers his age, Winston still wears diapers, but is getting used to using the potty. Winston was the nicest of the three Bixby children. He hated whenever Amanda and Jonathan fought with each other, and he didn't want to be like them. He became friends with other toddlers his age, namely Ryan McHiggins, Brad Hunter, Alice Finklemeyer, and Luke O'Reilly.

Melanie Martindale, age 1. The daughter of Morgan and Mallory, and the younger sister of Mike. Melanie is younger than the other toddlers, who can all run around and talk. She is also too young to be potty-trained, so as a result, she still wears diapers. She also sleeps in a crib and drinks from a baby bottle. Mike is very glad to have Melanie as his little sister, and he is very protective of her as well. Melanie's goals in life are to walk all by herself and say her first words.
114.title: Someone Else

1141.content: Where will Luke be spending the day today?
1141.title: Luke O'Reilly

11411.content: Do any friends come to visit him?
11411.title: His House

1143.content: Where will Melanie be spending the day?
1143.title: Melanie Martindale

11431.content: She was at her house. She was being changed by Mike?
11431.title: Her House

1144.content: Will we focus on the Johnson sisters, a trio of girls that Alice has a "frenemy" relationship with?
1144.title: Someone Else

11441.content: Will we focus on all three Johnson sisters or just one?
11441.title: Yes

114411.content: All three are where when this story begins?
114411.title: All Three

1144113.content: Where else could they be?
1144113.title: Any place else.

114412.content:
Which Johnson sister will we focus on?

* Jillian - The brawn. She's the eldest sister, being three minutes older than Jane and six minutes older than Janet. She's the meanest of the sisters, as he is constantly in a bad mood. She hates boys, and thinks that girls are superior to them in any way. She also delights in picking on her sisters, but she objects to anybody else doing it. Both she and Alice truly want to be friends with each other, but feel that can only happen if one of them changes their ways. Alice thinks Jillian should be nicer to boys, while Jillian thinks Alice should stop spending so much time around them.

* Jane - The brains. She's the middle sister, being three minutes younger than Jillian and three minutes older than Janet. She's the smartest of the sisters, as she knows how to read, use the potty by herself, and play a toy piano. Like Jillian, she thinks that girls are superior to boys in every way (with the exception of Janet).

* Janet - The beauty. She's the youngest sister, being six minutes younger than Jillian and three minutes younger than Jane. She's the nicest of the sisters, as she has no animosity towards boys whatsoever. She has an unrequited crush on Brad, who unfortunately sees her as annoying and crazy.
114412.title: Just One

1144122.content: Jane is where when we start?
1144122.title: Jane

11441222.content: Where else could Jane go?
11441222.title: Somewhere else.

12.content:
Which of the older kids do we focus on?

Butch Ironhammer, age 4.5. The son of Harold and Maxine. Butch is big, strong, and mean, and has given himself a reputation for being a big bully. He hates babies, and is not nice to kids his own age, either. In fact, he's been kicked out of preschool several times for his violent behavior. Butch rules the playground and tries to keep "stupid babies" off of it, but what he has in muscle, he lacks in brains. Thanks in part to being a preschool drop-out, he can't read or even count to three. He loves meats and sweets, but hates vegetables, as he thinks they're only for girls and rabbits. Butch's pets include a bulldog named Meathook and a spider named Trapper.

Mike Martindale, age 6. The son of Morgan and Mallory, and the older brother of Melanie. Mike is good at many different things, such as rollerblading, skateboarding, baseball, and video games, but he also has a soft spot for children under the age of three, namely due to having a baby sister of his own. He has a crush on Sigrid Silverman, is fully supportive of Ryan and Brad's crushes on Alice, and isn't afraid to stand up to bullies like Butch.
12.title: One of the Older Kids

122.content: Where will Mike be spending the day today?
122.title: Mike Martindale

1221.content:
Mike was spending the day at his house.

Did any friends come to visit him?
1221.title: His House

choices: The Johnson sisters, or anyone else.
12211.content: Who came by to see him, Sigrid?
12211.title: Yes

1222.content: Is he at Alice's, helping to babysit her with one of his friends?
1222.title: A Friend's House

1225.content: Where else could Mike be spending the day?
1225.title: Somewhere Else

123.content:
Okay, then. How about...

Sigrid Silverman, age 6. The daughter of Sidney and Sandra. Sigrid is a kind and beautiful girl. She has a crush on Mike, who likewise, returns her affections. She is Amanda's best friend and often acts as a voice of reason for her. Her pet is a black cat named Jasmine.

Amanda Bixby, age 6. The daughter of Albert and Geraldine, and the older sister of Jonathan (age 4) and Winston (age 2.5). Amanda is very bossy and likes to assert her position as both the eldest child and the only daughter. She resents having two younger brothers, and wishes she had a little sister instead. She and Jonathan are constantly at each other's throats, and although Amanda takes delight in bossing her brothers about, she objects to anyone else doing it. She is best friends with Sigrid, who often acts as a voice of reason for her, but Mike finds it hard to get along with her, and wishes she would treat her brothers the way he treats his little sister. Amanda is jealous of Mike for having a little sister.
123.title: Someone Else

13.content:
Which parent do we focus on?

Walter McHiggins, age 25. Ryan's father. Walter resembles an adult version of Ryan in both looks and personality. He works as a stockman at the local Mega Mart. Walter is actually very good at his job and is willing to help out his wife and son whenever he can, but he's still a child at heart. Ryan takes after him in both looks and personality.

Wendy McHiggins, age 24. Ryan's mother. Wendy spends a lot of her time taking care of Ryan, but in her spare time, she likes to pursue her passion of writing. Although she only has one son, she sometimes feels like she has two. The other one? Walter.

Stephen Hunter, age 25. Brad's father and Walter's best friend. Stephen has an extensive knowledge of video games, which makes him the ideal employee at the local GameShop. Although he's very good at his job and he's willing to help out his wife and son whenever he can, he spends a lot of his spare time playing video games, and is also more of a softy when it comes to disciplining Brad. Stephen and Walter have been best friends since childhood, and their friendship lives on through their sons, Brad and Ryan.

Ashley Hunter, age 24. Brad's mother. She spends a lot of her time taking care of Brad, and she's also much more strict than Stephen is when it comes to disciplining him. Underneath her motherly exterior, she enjoys video games and is always happy to be Stephen's second player.
13.title: One of the Parents

info.brief_description: A series of interactive stories based on Toddlerhood, a series by FDMG Productions.
info.description:
A series of interactive stoies based on Toddlerhood, a future animated series by FDMG Productions.

Rules:

1. No vore, gore or deaths.
2. Diaper changes are allowed.
3. No age progression/Age regression.
4. Please keep each chapter E-rated. Offensive language should be limited to implications, and sexual content is strictly prohibited.
5. Keep it realistic. Unrealistic situations should be limited to imagine spots and dream sequences.
6. Nudity should be limited to bathtime and potty-training.
7. Enjoy and have fun!
